ai.summary: A demanding 48.4 km long-distance hike in the UK, challenging the legs with varied countryside along the Chiltern landscape. Suitable for experienced hikers prepared for long distances and changing weather.
ai.terrain_summary: Long trail with mixed terrain including rural farmland, woodland, and occasional gentle climbs. Expect uneven paths, some mud, and gated or stiles; several road crossings may be required.
ai.safety_notes: Hard distance and variable UK weather require solid navigation and fitness. Plan for sufficient daylight, water, and food. Carry a map and compass, a fully charged phone, and a basic first-aid kit. Inform someone of your route and expected finish. Be prepared for muddy or slippery sections and sudden weather changes.
recommended_gear: Good quality walking boots or trail shoes
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 litres)
Small first-aid kit and emergency whistle
Lightweight emergency bivy or space blanket
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn generally offer comfortable temperatures and improved trail conditions; summer is possible with longer daylight but can be hot, and winter hikes are challenging due to weather and shorter days.

seo.title: Chiltern Link – 48.4 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 48.4 km Chiltern Link, a challenging long-distance hike in the UK. Get terrain, safety tips, gear suggestions, and best seasons.
